Executive Summary
It is the policy of the City of College Station, Texas, to operate safe water and wastewater treatment facilities, reducing to the greatest extent possible any hazards associated with our processes, and reducing any subsequent risk to the surrounding community, our employees, and the environment.  It is also our policy to work with the surrounding community and local emergency response agencies, and promote a spirit of cooperation and teamwork, to orchestrate an effective contingency plan in the unlikely event that a process incident occurs at one of our plants.

Primary Activity
The primary activity at the Sandy Point Pump Station is municipal water disinfection and distribution.

Use of Regulated Substance
Chlorine is used primarily as a disinfectant prior to distribution in the drinking water supply.

Quantity Handled or Stored
Chlorine: 10,000 pounds

Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps
The Sandy Point Pump Station is in compliance with the RMP Rule, 40 CFR 68.  The Facility has conducted a comprehensive review of all systems, as well as administrative, technical, operating, and maintenance procedures, in addition to the other required program elements of the rule.  

Five Year Accident History
The Sandy Point Pump Station has never had a significant release of a hazardous substance as defined by this Rule.

Emergency Response Program
This facility has an Emergency Response Program that is coordinated with the community plan.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety
The following recommendations were made as a result of the Sandy Point Pump Station Risk Management Program.  Recommendations originally developed in 1999 and implemented are:
?  Water Production employees are issued updated operating procedures and are trained using the procedures.
?  Emergency response procedures are reviewed annually and revised as appropriate.
?  Chlorine vendors are required to supply driver training documentation.  Drivers wh

o are B-Kit trained and qualified will receive preference over vendors who do not supply training documentation.  
?  County Sheriffs Department has initiated more frequent patrols of the facility.
?  Operational Procedures include:
1.  Chlorine containers are not handled or moved without caps in place.
2.  All lines are evacuated prior to removing regulating check units.
?  Full containment of storage area with emergency scrubber installation is being explored.
